SEARCH
Package io.github.jspinak.brobot.datatypes.primitives.location

Class Location

java.lang.Object
io.github.jspinak.brobot.datatypes.primitives.location.Location
public class Location extends Object
Represents a point on the screen in the Brobot model-based GUI automation framework.

A Location defines a specific point that can be specified in two ways:

  • Absolute coordinates: Using x,y pixel values directly
  • Relative position: As a percentage position within a Region
Both methods support optional x,y offsets for fine-tuning the final position.

In the model-based approach, Locations are essential for:

  • Specifying click targets within GUI elements
  • Defining anchor points for spatial relationships between elements
  • Positioning the mouse for hover actions
  • Creating dynamic positions that adapt to different screen sizes

The relative positioning feature is particularly powerful in model-based automation as it allows locations to remain valid even when GUI elements move or resize, making automation more robust to UI changes.

Since:
1.0
See Also:

      public Location()
      Creates a Location at the origin (0,0).

    • Location

      public Location(int x, int y)
      Creates a Location at the specified absolute coordinates.
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate in pixels
      y - the y-coordinate in pixels

    • Location

      public Location(Region region, org.sikuli.script.Location sikuliLocation)

    • Location

      public Location(Region region)
      Creates a Location at the center of the specified Region.

      This constructor is useful for targeting the middle of GUI elements in a way that remains valid even if the element moves or resizes.

      Parameters:
      region - the Region to center the Location in

    • Location

      public Location(Region region, Position position)
      Creates a Location at a specific position within a Region.

      The Position specifies where within the Region this Location points to, using percentage values (0.0 to 1.0) for both width and height.

      Parameters:
      region - the Region containing this Location
      position - the relative position within the Region

    • sikuli

      public org.sikuli.script.Location sikuli()
      Converts this Location to a SikuliX Location for compatibility.

      This method calculates the final screen coordinates (including any offsets) and returns them as a SikuliX Location object for use with Sikuli operations.

      Returns:
      a SikuliX Location with the calculated screen coordinates

    • getRegionH

      public int getRegionH()

    • defined

      public boolean defined()
      Checks if this Location has valid coordinates.

      A Location is considered defined if it has either valid x,y coordinates or a valid Region with position. This is important for validating click targets before attempting interactions.

      Returns:
      true if the Location can produce valid screen coordinates

    • add

      public void add(Location loc)
      Adds another Location's coordinates to this Location.

      If the locations use different definition methods (absolute vs relative), the result will be converted to absolute coordinates. This is useful for creating offset positions from a base location.

      Parameters:
      loc - the Location to add to this one
